comment: I like her way teaching, very understandable and caring. Quizzes,homework and discussion question every Saturday not bad at all. She does explain everything in class what's going to be on the test. I would take her again best teacher!

Professor is nice, responds to emails quickly, confusing lectures. Class: Weekly hw, discussions, & unit exams, plus final. Hw on webassign. Discussions graded by correctness, timeliness, & LOTS of peer interaction. Unit exams & final are open book/open note, but hard & non reflective of hw or discussions. (8)HW 25% (7)D 25% (7)UE 30% FINAL 20%

All of her lectures are prerecorded but easy to follow. Make sure to read/watch her lecture before her recitations (which are mandatory to attend for a grade). We had Webassign HW, discussions, quizzes every week. The class was not hard and easy to follow. She answers questions in class, if its about homework or another topic, save it for the end.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: I would say this is one of the easiest physics class. She explains the lab and procedures thoroughly and provides all formulas before conducting it. She cares about her students and helps if you get stuck on a procedure. She posts videos before each lab so you have a better understanding of the procedure. 8 labs in total, 1 dropped.

I had her online and did pretty well considering the level of difficulty of this course. You must watch her lectures every week in order to get a better understanding of the material. There was a quiz, hw, and discussion due every week. 4 tests and a final. She does answer all your queries and is very caring. Study hard and pay attention to pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: She cares but only about you taking her class. There is homework, quizzes, discussion, and recitation weekly. Do NOT take her class if you are not prepared to spend at least 5 hours daily for this class alone. Shes there to help if you need her though and you will need her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Ms. Ranasinghe was very confusing to say the least. Her tests are really hard and although she gives two bonus points, the questions are impossible. She posts study guides that are nothing like the actual test. She also doesn't give out any extra credit or curve anything, other than one test because everybody did horrible. I wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Physics is HARD, but she genuinely wants us to understand. If you attend lectures, recitation, and do homework (no chegg), you should be fine. She is reasonable and wants us to succeed. Was very considerate during the shift to online class. She answers questions without being rude. She's pretty funny too.

Gained little from lectures, and asking for help made it worse. Lots of confusion over exactly which sections exams will cover as its not clear. Q's may not reflect hw, recitation, or book problems. Common to feel CONFIDENT prior to a test due to studying past tests, hw, and quizzes only to struggle horribly during tests which is a 1st for me.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: She was not a great professor, I had to learn majority of the material outside of class. Spent many hours in the tutoring building.

Fantastic professor and even better person! Its a typical physics class... decent amount of homework but manageable (12-18ish problems per assignment). She is willing to extend a homework or a quiz if the class collectively agrees which is uncommon and extremely helpful. Exam problems mimic recitation and in class example problems. Great Choice!

Easy A during the summer semester, Im glad I went ahead and took it. 7 discussions, 7 tests, online (paid) homework, and a final. Somewhat early participation is needed for discussions and you must reply to her comments. Very easygoing and helpful. If you need phys1111 take her class over the summer, you wont regret it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: I took online 1111 class with Dr Kisa. She is an easy A for Physics 1111 for the summer semester. Tests are very easy. She grade you over participation to her discussions answers and tests. There was 6 quiz 1 final and 6 discussion. Her lecture videos are fantastic. She replies emails very quick. She really cares about her students. Take her online
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures

comment: No Phys II class is easy, but she makes it so much more bearable. Go to class and recitation! Lectures are clear and engaging, but you have to work for your grade. Homework isn't graded, but its HIGHLY recommended you do it; the tests will have similar questions to the HW and recitation. Put in the effort to study/practice and you'll be just fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: In my opinion she is not a "teacher". She knows the knowledge, but has no clue on how to pass it on. The HW was not for credit and there was A LOT of it. She likes to derive formulas instead of doing example problems. Works with variables for everything which does not help me at all. I am an A-B student, I got a D.

Not good at answering questions, will confuse you more if you ask her. Class consists of quizzes, webassign hw, 5 tests (lowest dropped), & a final. Her quizzes are hard, but most of the answers are online. The tests are slightly easier, but still confusing. The homework isnt bad, be sure to rework it several times before a test. Recitations suck
She's a good choice
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is a good lecturer. Her accent is not a big issue. Her homework is very hard and not very helpful.

She has required discussion posts.  You have to ask one question and then answer two (which means that by the end there aren't any left to answer).  Seemingly arbitrary with grading these.  Syllabus is a maze.  Most of the homework and quiz questions are too complicated for the amount of teaching that is done.   Most questions are on Answers.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Allows a formula sheet on each test. Homework through Webassign. She's a woman of many errors, sweet as can be though. There was not one quiz or test without some sort of error on it. Sometimes the question was just impossible, other times the answers were all off by a factor of 10, other times the correct answer wasn't offered. Avoid if possible.

Her tests were not too hard. However, she had an insane grading method. She would make the final response question worth 40 points. So even if you got every question on the test correct but missed the last one you would get a 60. That really doesn't reflect whether or not a student knows the material. I definitely wouldn't take her again.

Physics 1 was a hard subject, and Dr. Ranasinghe was not helpful to make the learning process easier. Her lectures were not clear and easy to understand( I'm not talking about her accent). Test questions were really hard,and it was not clear to me what exactly I had to study for. In general SHE IS NOT AN ORGANIZED PROFESSOR.

Physics 2 is a really hard class, but Dr. Ranasinghe made it quite manageable. The tests are atrociously hard, but she gives you many chances to offset the tests with homework, quizzes, etc. She is very good at explaining the concepts, and though she has an accent, she is not difficult to understand. I would take her again.
Great prof.
Excellent
Great prof!

I LOVE DR KISA!  She is so nice and helpful.  If you show up to class and get to know her, you can tell that she really wants you to succeed in here class.  I learned so much from her.  Her accent is a little thick but you adjust to it very quickly.

She is a wonderful physic professor. She make sure you understand the material, work a lot of examples and her exams are not hard. Attend classes when you are suppose to, go to recitation and do the homework problems you will get an A.

Tests are fairly straightforward and pulled straight from recitations. There's also a ~20% "extra credit" margin on them, so there's really no reason to get under an A, much less a B. And if that isn't enough, the lowest one is even dropped. Basically: Tests are easy, just pay attention in recitation.

Very knowledgeable and pretty clear during lectures. Has a pretty thick accent but isn't a big deal. Attending lecture and recitation isn't mandatory and you can afford to miss a good bit of classes and still do well on tests. Just study homework problems before each test and you'll be fine.

I enjoyed Prof. Ranasinghe. She has a bit of accent but you'll get used to it. Go to recitation because that's where test questions are from. She is caring and wants to make sure you understand. She curves test grades to get a passing average. No extra credit was offered, but we had on line quizzes with 5 questions each week based on the homework.
Very helpful. Exam questions are pulled from recitations. Knows what she is talking about and does not go off subject like other physics professors.
She is very hard to understand. If you have not already taken Physics and already completely understand it then this class is not for you!
